Name: 7up
Description: Soft drink, a distributed internationally by PepsiCo
Reason: The international distributer of 7up, PepsiCo, bought SodaStream for $3.2bn and owns 50% of Sabra both of which had taken advantage of the Israeli occupation of Palestine.
How to Boycott: Dont buy 7up products. Don't sell 7up products. Don't work for the PepsiCo Company.
Alternatives: Supermarket own brand products, eg. Aldi, Asda, Lidl. Barr Drinks (owner of Irn Bru).

Name: Acqua Panna
Description: Acqua Panna is a water brand owned by Nestle.
Reason: The owner of the Acqua Panna brand, Nestle, owns a controlling stake in Osem. Osem is an Israeli food manufacturer which operates in Occupied Palestine.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Acqua Panna products. Avoid Nestle products until they divest all operations in Occupied Palestine. Especially avoid any Osem brands such as Sabra and others which can be found via the wikipedia page in the source.
Alternatives: Supermarket own brand products, eg. Aldi, Asda, Lidl. Saka water (from Turkiye).

Name: Appletiser
Description: Soft drink brand owned by the Coca Cola company.
Reason: Coca-Cola Company which owns Appletiser, operates a factory in the illegal Israeli settlement of Atarot, which is built in Occupied Palestine.
How to Boycott: Dont buy Appletiser. Don't sell Appletiser. Don't work for the Coca-Cola Company.
Alternatives: Supermarket own brand products, eg. Aldi, Asda, Lidl. Barr Drinks (owner of Irn Bru).

How to Boycott: Don't buy Eden Springs products. Don't place Eden Springs coolers and coffee machines in your business. Pressure your workplace to stop using Eden Springs products.

How to Boycott: Dont buy Lipton Iced Tea products. Don't sell Lipton Iced Tea products. Don't work for Unilever. Don't work for Pepsico.

Name: Marks and Spencer / M&S
Description: British multinational retailer that specialises in selling clothing, beauty products, home products and food products.
Reason: Marks & Spencer has been a pro zionist entity since its inception, with various members of its management openly declaring support for the zionist state. For over 100 years, they have been the biggest commercial conduit between Israel and the UK. More recently however, they have publicly distanced themselves from having 'political' ties and aims. And since the last statements in support of Israel were around the year 2000, it is difficult to tell how much their leadership supports Israel.
How to Boycott: Don't shop at M&S. Don't work for M&S.
Alternatives: Asda. Co-op.
